docs.snippet: The final rosters for the World Cup included a few surprises: Germany will bring only one striker, and Colombia will leave Radamel Falcao at home.

headline.main: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 9

docs.snippet: Fifty years ago this week, a group of mostly blue-collar workers and army conscripts led Israel to its only senior international soccer title, winning the 1964 Asian Cup in front of rapturous home crowds.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago this week, a group of mostly blue-collar workers and army conscripts led Israel to its only senior international soccer title, winning the 1964 Asian Cup in front of rapturous home crowds.

docs.snippet: Italy was held to a 1-1 draw by Luxembourg on Wednesday in its final World Cup warm-up match before leaving for Brazil, with forward Mario Balotelli looking in impressive form.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy was held to a 1-1 draw by Luxembourg on Wednesday in its final World Cup warm-up match before leaving for Brazil, with forward Mario Balotelli looking in impressive form.

docs.snippet: An experimental England side gave a decent performance in a 2-2 draw with Ecuador who equalised through a superb strike by substitute Michael Arroyo before both sides were reduced to 10 men in an incident-packed World Cup warm-up match on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: An experimental England side gave a decent performance in a 2-2 draw with Ecuador who equalised through a superb strike by substitute Michael Arroyo before both sides were reduced to 10 men in an incident-packed World Cup warm-up match on Wednesday.

headline.main: Two Sent Off as England Held by Battling Ecuador
headline.print_headline: Two Sent Off as England Held by Battling Ecuador

docs.snippet: Italy coach Cesare Prandelli saw no cause for alarm in his side's 1-1 draw with tiny Luxembourg on Wednesday in their last international friendly before heading to the World Cup in Brazil.

docs.snippet: With a passionate crowd behind them, a savvy coach and a settled team enjoying a sparkling run of form Brazil are hot favourites to lift a record sixth World Cup this July.
